required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical and Functional Outcome of the MobileLink Acetabular Cup System in the Short-, Mid-, and Longterm Follow-up
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Functional Outcome of the MobileLink Acetabular Cup System in the Short-, Mid-, and Longterm Follow-up

brief_summary.textblock:
The implantation of artificial hip joints is one of the most frequently performed surgeries. Normally, patients are very satisfied with the results.
The MobileLink hip prosthesis system is a CE marked medical device. This means the the safety and performance of the prosthesis ist approved. Aim of the study is to collect clinical data about the outcome of the MobileLink hip prosthesis systen under routine condition and the determine the satisfaction of the patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Survival rate of the complete MobileLink hip prosthesis system with revision for any reason as the endpoint,

secondary_outcome.measure: Revision rates of the complete MobileLink acetabular cup system with revision for any reason except peri-prosthetic infections as the endpoint
Revision rates of the MobileLink acetabular cup system shell(s) with revision for any reason as the endpoint
Revision rates of the MobileLink acetabular cup system inserts (Ceramic, XLINKed, E-Dur) with revision for any reason as the endpoint
Revision rates of the combined LINK hip stem(s) with revision for any reason as the endpoint

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operatively and at the 3 months, 1 year, 3, 5, 7 and 10 year follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: measured by the Harris Hip Score (HHS) (maximum 100 points, minimum 0 points, a higher score indicates a better outcome)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operatively and at the 3 months, 1 year, 3, 5, 7 and 10 year follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: measured by the Hip disability and osteoarthritis outcome score (HOOS), (maximum 100 points, minimum 0 points, a higher score indicates a better outcome)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of complications and re-operations of the hip joint

secondary_outcome.description: radiological assessment, classified according to Brooker

secondary_outcome.measure: Type and rate of complications with the used instruments related tp usability and sterilization
Survival rate of the complete MobileLink hip prosthesis system with revision for any reason as the endpoint,
Survival rate of the complete MobileLink hip prosthesis system with revision for any reason as the endpoint,
Survival rate of the complete MobileLink hip prosthesis system with revision for any reason as the endpoint,
Survival rate of the complete MobileLink hip prosthesis system with revision for any reason as the endpoint,
Survival rate of the complete MobileLink hip prosthesis system with revision for any reason as the endpoint,
Survival rate of the complete MobileLink hip prosthesis system with revision for any reason as the endpoint,

intervention.description: Patients who receive a MobileLink hip prosthesis system will be followed-up for 10 years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Implantation of a MobileLink acetabular cup system and a femoral stem manufactured by Waldemar Link
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Fully signed patient informed cons
Exclusion Criteria:
- Revisions
- Body Mass Index (BMI) ≥ 40 kg/m²
- Patient who is foreseeable not able to understand the study and the study-related circumstances
- Patients who is foreseeable non-compliant to the treatment and the follow-ups
- Pregnant or breast-feeding women
- Prisoner
